title: What is the purpose of useEffect in React?
ans: useEffect is a React hook that runs side effects in function components, such as fetching data or updating the DOM after renders.

title: What is a custom hook in React and when should you use one?
ans: A custom hook is a JavaScript function that lets you reuse stateful logic between components, and you should use it when the logic is shared among components.

title: Difference between controlled and uncontrolled components. Which one is better??
ans: Controlled components are driven by React state, while uncontrolled components manage their own state internally; controlled components are generally preferred for better control and consistency.

title: Tell us something about useFormStatus() in React.?
ans: useFormStatus is a hook used to track the status of form submission and validation in React, especially when working with forms that need to be tracked for their loading or submission state.
